meanings.definition: Causing or characterized by extreme distress or sorrow.
meanings.sent1: The news of the accident was tragical, leaving everyone in tears.
meanings.sent2: The movie's tragical ending left the audience feeling sad.
meanings.sent3: It was tragical how the ice cream fell off the cone just before reaching my mouth.
meanings.sent4: The tragical loss of the championship game haunted the team for years.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the abandoned puppy was tragical, tugging at everyone's heartstrings.

meanings.sent1: The play had a tragical plot that kept the audience engaged.
meanings.sent2: The novel's tragical elements added depth to the storyline.
meanings.sent3: It was tragical how the main character always faced misfortune.
meanings.sent4: The tragical events in the story mirrored real-life struggles.
meanings.sent5: The tragical twist in the tale took everyone by surprise.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a tragedy or tragedies.
meanings.sent1: The museum displayed artifacts from tragical events in history.
meanings.sent2: The poet wrote about the tragical hero in his latest work.
meanings.sent3: It was tragical how the ancient city met its demise.
meanings.sent4: The tragical outcome of the war was depicted in the painting.
meanings.sent5: The tragical theme of the play resonated with the audience.
